Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Alright everybody, great season of softball, I'm super proud of you guys and I think you're gonna like this little highlight reel that I put together. [Andy plays video]

Quote.Speaker: Group
Quote.Text: Dunder Mifflin!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Andy Bernard presents: Summer Softball Epic Fails! [Kevin swings bat on screen, fart noise follows] Fail. [repeats] Fail.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: That's me. [repeats]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Fail.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Is this like a blooper reel?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: A blooper reel? What is this, 2005? I look like Bob Saget? Fail! [Points to video] Who's this guy? [Jim steps back and forth from plate on video as Andy sings Meow Mix theme]Look at him dance. Fail!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Fail!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I deserved that.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [Darryl runs in slow motion on video] Do do do do do do do.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: That was a triple.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Can't take the fail? Get out of the fail video!

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: My pleasure.

Quote.Speaker: Description
Quote.Text: [Clark and Pete are shown on screen]

Quote.Speaker: Video Andy
Quote.Text: Hey, I'm Pete, puberty is such a drag, man. And I'm Clark! I like to eat toilet paper. [Clark and Pete wave at camera] We fail! [Video shows memorial of Jerry]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I'd like to take a solemn moment to remember Jerry in the warehouse who passed away this year. [Screen flashes 'FAIL' over Jerry's face, accompanied by fart noise, repeats twice.] Well, that's all folks. [photo of Andy watersking shows on screen] Ski ya later everybody. Thanks for a great season. [Group claps halfheartedly]

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: What was that? That was just a normal video with you making vulgar noises.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Well, I worked with what I had, Oscar. Next time do more failure stuff, OK?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Uh, what happened to that video I sent you?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Oh that wasn't...that didn't work. That was not the right..[Group protests]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I think I got it right here. [Cheering on screen, Andy struggles with lifting water cooler, then falls over dumping the fluids on himself][Group laughs]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: That was not a fail.

Quote.Speaker: Group
Quote.Text: Fail! Fail! Fail!...

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [Group continues chanting "Fail!"]That was actually a serious accident that could have resulted in severe bodily harm. [Group keeps chanting] You're all failing right now. [Group continues] Congratulations on your epic fail of the use of the word fail! [Group claps and chants]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [Toby uses tester on wall as Erin marks wall with red tape X] Oh, god.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: What's going on?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Nothing! Nothing is going on. Keep moving please.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: What's he measuring?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: OK, excuse me. I am the landlord. This is between me and the management, no one else. Please.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: It's an EMF hotspot.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: [Gasps] Oh my god!

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: It stands for electromagnetic field. Generally cause by a concentration of wiring in one area [Erin marks red tape X on the floor] Especially if they're poorly insulated. Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Um, OK I'm just walking into this. Am I to understand there is a bee hive in the wall?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: You think I have a machine for measuring bee hives?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I was just asking a question, Toby. How are you not murdered every hour?

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Well I'm not getting paid to work in a microwave oven.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: OK, listen. Everything here is up to code.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [mocking] Oh, the wires need insulation. [normal voice] It's a wire people. I'm not buying it a fur coat.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [Jim rushes to open door for her] Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You got it.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Last week, I finally told Pam about the other job I took in Philly...the side job. And she was so incredibly cool about it. And now I just wanna do something huge for her. Like if we were in some biker bar and she mouthed off to some bikers and they came lumbering over and I was like wham! [mimes punch] Gotta go through me first.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Andy, could I have a word please? Um, it won't take a moment. It's extremely important and it really has to happen now.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Fine. I will give you one minute.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Oh, please don't use the hourglass.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: You have one minute and your minute has begun and no time will be added at the end, even to accommodate this sentence with all of it's baroque dependent clauses and cascading turns of phrase.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: I'm trying to adopt a baby.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: A baby what? A human?!

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: And the...agency require a character reference from my employer.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Oh.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: You wouldn't have to do anything. I would write the letter myself and you just simply sign it. So.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Oh, OK. And fall right into your plagiarism entrapment scheme? I don't think so.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: It's not..it's-

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: And I happen to notice you're down to about thirty seconds here.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Well then if I could just convince...

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: And those sand grains are tumbling..

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: You.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: With fury...

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: It's not..it's not

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Down the sides..

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Entrapment if I'm..

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Of the hourglass..

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: ..writing..

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Time's up!

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Fine.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Sure. I'll read her letter. And if she tells the truth about how evil and unfit to be a mother she is, then yeah. I'll sign that.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [Reading from computer] "Statistical correlations exist between EMF radiation and various health hazards. But mainstream studies are inconclusive!" That means you can't make me do squat.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: You better fix this. I already ditched my uterus and I ain't losing any more good parts.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You people don't realize what you're asking. I'd have to rip open the walls. We'd have to shut this place down for a week.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Week off. That'd be great.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: [Jim puts popcorn bag in microwave] Hey, if you don't want to teach me Power Point, just say so.

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: I don't want to teach you Power Point.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Come on! Just show me the Power Point.

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: Just do the tutorial.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: You're the tutorial.

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: No, dude, I'm not. I'm not the tutorial.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: You could be.

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: Mm-mm.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: [to Jim] What are you doing?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Getting my wife a week off from work.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: You popped one kernel.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Awesome, right? [leaves]

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: So Creed is that dude's step dad?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Correct.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Well, I don't know about the rest of you but I'm just gonna say it. I'm nervous. I have no idea what health problems this is all gonna cause. [group agrees, protests]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What? Come on.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: I'm getting older. I'm losing my hair...

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: I'm not gonna grow a third arm!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I know what Jim is trying to do. He's trying to get big bad Dwight to shell out for a huge repair job while lucky Jimbo gets a paid vacation. Well sorry, lucky Jimbo, I can live very happily in a magnetic field. Most of my childhood heroes got their power that way.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [reading from computer] "Side effects of EMF include: headaches..."

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Had 'em all my life.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: "..breast pain..."

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No nobbies, no probbies. Nice try Jim.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oof. "Infertility."

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [scoffs] Yeah right. [Dwight moves mouse pad over his crotch]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Ah! There's my popcorn. Can you just grab that for me?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Psh. Keep your snacks on your side, Jim. Idiot. [notices popped kernels in the bag] What the?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Some of these kernels have crowned.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: That's impossible, cause that's a brand new bag...[looks up to ceiling where there is a red tape X over Dwight's chair] Oh my god.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Andy! [Jim mimes basketball shot]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I'm gonna drive you up to the lake, give you a whole week on the water. Just you, me and the kids.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, can we stop by that pie stand on the way?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You mean Laverne's Pies Tires Fixed Also? [Pam nods] Yes we will be doing that. We'll be getting a dozen.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: A dozen different pies? Cause that means rhubarb.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Why would you say that? I meant 4 apple, 4 blueberry, 2 cherry, 1 peach and 1 chocolate. I thought that was implied.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah, OK then.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Ladies and gentlemen, I have heard your complaints and we reached a settlement.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: So, we will be leaving the office for one whole week.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Nice job.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: In my contract, it is stipulated that I provide a temporary work space. It will arrive in one hour.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: What's this?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Whoa!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [Bus pulls into lot] Bring it in!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Roll into the future with Work Bus. Say goodbye to wasteful buildings. These days a mobile office isn't just for hotshot politicians. Now anyone can rent a work bus. [Meredith and Kevin bump chairs in bus angrily] If you've got a parking lot, a work space is just a phone call away. [Erin tapes candy dish to pole] In this age of belt tightening and less empowered workers, a work bus is how tomorrow gets things done.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: [on phone] There are a hundred packs..

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: [On phone] No six after the eight, no....

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Shh!

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Shh!

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Ninety nine cases..yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Six. [Pete opens air vent over Angela, papers go flying]

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Ooh!

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: Oh sorry! Sorry.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Oh my god!

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: [bumps into Meredith] Sorry.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Lose weight.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: I'm trying. Sorry.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: [handing Nelly envelope] Oh, the Pennsylvania Department of Public Welfare Pre-Adoption Standard.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Oh of course, you were adopted.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: [laughs] I wish! No, I um, I made some short lists. I had a couple sleepovers, but I never managed to get in the end zone. I don't know what it was. Not loveable maybe? [laughs] Oh well.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Listen, I'm really struggling with this form. But as you know the system, you think maybe you could..?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Absolutely. I know exactly what they want to hear. I would love to help.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Oh thank you so much!

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: [whispers] Just don't tell Andy, because..

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: He hates me and thinks I'm a monster. Should go back to Loch Ness. [Erin nods]

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: Stretch. Alright.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: How many times do you need to take a stroll?

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: I, my legs cramp up! Ok, it's a circulation issue.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Boy, I will hammer spank your rear.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Alright, alright, gang. Let's just settle down. You're yelling in her face.

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: It's a medical thing.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Just...you good?

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: I'm good. I..

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [to Pam] I'm so sorry for all of this.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: It's OK. You know what they say, a change is as good as a rest.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I, I need to get to the paper please. [Reaching for overhead bin above Pam, papers fall and Pam has liquid spilled on her]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh my god! Ah!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I'll get you a napkin. Someone get napkins please!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You know what? It's fine, it's fine. Let me just...it's fine. [Pam leaves work bus]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Pam, I'm really sorry. I- I'm really sorry about...all that. [Dwight smiles at Jim] Really? Smirking?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What can I say? I love justice. You forced me to spend money on needless repairs, and uh now you're locked in a prison bus and your woman drips with beverage.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey, Dwight. I was trying to do something nice for Pam. Can you just, help me out? Can we maybe take this thing somewhere? Or do something to not make this the worst day ever?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It's not my responsibility to solve your marriage problems by spending my money on gas.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Andy!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yo. Dudeces.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You're the boss. Don't you think we'd all be a lot more productive if while we were doing work we looked up and saw the best rural pie stand in Pennsylvania?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Oh, I know I'd be more productive.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: As would I.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: No question.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No. No! This is a work bus. The wheels are for transporting the work space to and from the work site.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What are you talking about? You're not the boss. Andy is. Andy?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis, Kevin & Stanley
Quote.Text: Pies! Pies! Pies! Pies! Pies!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Alright! The fat people have spoken! Dwight, get this bus moving.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Yes! [Group cheers]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Next stop: Laverne's Pies Tires Fixed Also.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh! Yes! [Group cheers, Dwight moves to driver seat]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [To Dwight] So it looks like this work bus was a pretty good idea after all, huh?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Get your foot behind the yellow line.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You got it.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Yeah Jim! [Group claps]

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: [Sitting outside building] Stop.

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: Come back.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Too late.

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: Mmm.

Quote.Speaker: Group
Quote.Text: Shabooyah, role call. Shabooyah, yah yah shabooyah, role call.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: My name is Pam.

Quote.Speaker: Group
Quote.Text: Yeah!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I like to paint.

Quote.Speaker: Group
Quote.Text: Yeah!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You think you're better?

Quote.Speaker: Group
Quote.Text: Yeah!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh no you ain't!

Quote.Speaker: Group
Quote.Text: Role Call! Shabooyah, yah yah shabooyah role call! Shabooyah, yah yah shabooyah, role call!

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: My name is Kevin.

Quote.Speaker: Group
Quote.Text: Yeah!

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: That is my name.

Quote.Speaker: Group
Quote.Text: Yeah!

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: They call me Kevin.

Quote.Speaker: Group
Quote.Text: Yeah!

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Cause that's my name.

Quote.Speaker: Group
Quote.Text: Role call! Shabooyah, yah yah shabooyah role call! Shabooyah, yah yah shabooyah role call!

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: [Dwight pulls over to pick up hitchhiker] Thanks. Playing a little hookey from work today....Oh my god.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Dunder Mifflin road trip twenty twelve! [group takes pictures] Ah OK, now a serious one.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hey, where's Dwight? He should be a part of this. Has he been acting kinda weird to you lately?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: If by lately you mean the last twelve years, yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No, I mean he's sulking. That's not like him.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: He's just mad that we're all having fun.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Then why isn't he scheming? Or preparing to avenge?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: He's fine. He's indestructible.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Always say that a child is placed for adoption, never surrendered. We're not hostages.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: [laughs] Well, I have considered kidnapping one.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Never say that.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: I am so excited thinking about this child you're going to adopt.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: I wish I could just wave a magic wand and make you a parentless five year old again. I would snap you up.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Next stop pies! [group joins in]

Quote.Speaker: Group
Quote.Text: Next stop pies!

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Next stop pies!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Let's go driver! [clapping] Laverne packs up the pie wagon at five so...

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: At five? That's only twenty minutes from now. The pie shop is thirteen miles away. So at fifty five miles an hour that just gives us five minutes to spare.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: So wait, when pies are involved you can suddenly do math in your head?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Wh...

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Hold on, Kevin, how much is 19,154 pies divided by 61 pies?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: 314 pies.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: What if it were salads?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Well, it's the...carry the four...and...it doesn't work.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I'm sorry to spoil Jim's fantastic voyage everyone, but we're almost out of gas.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: OK, well I saw a station about a mile back so, chop chop.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: That name brand place? Nope forget about it, sorry. The tanks are so big on this thing, five cents a gallon extra, that really adds up.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Are you kidding me? Dwight, come on!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hey honey, I don't think we should push him.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh no, I'm gonna push him. You know why? Because you're getting a pie. Why? Cause you deserve it. And what is he doing? He's trying to drive us all around the countryside looking for gas because he knows we won't get there. Is that what we want?!

Quote.Speaker: Group
Quote.Text: No!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Stop ordering me around, Jim!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What do we want?!

Quote.Speaker: Group
Quote.Text: Pies!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: When do we want it?!

Quote.Speaker: Group
Quote.Text: Pies!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: OK, fine. You win. Jim, you win. We have been battling for a long time, but you know what? You win, cause you are the winner, you are the alpha male, there you go. [drops keys in Jim's lap] Alpha male, go buy your wife a pie. Go buy the whole world a pie.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: That's impossible. [Dwight climbs through ceiling hatch] Dwight!

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Oh my!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What are you doing?

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Dwight, what the hell?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Dwight!

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Well now I don't even feel like pie. Wait...no it's back.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: [Dwight's footsteps sound from the ceiling] Just drive away. Just..

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Phyllis! That's not safe.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Guys, we only have eighteen minutes left. At sixty one miles an hour we're just gonna barely make it.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [to Jim] Go up and check on him. He's upset.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You know he's doing all this on purpose.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Please? Just make sure he's OK? [Jim climbs through hatch]

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Hurry it up for god's sake. They're gonna be out of banana cream!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Banana cream is the first to go. We'll be lucky to get pumpkin at this point! [group gasps]

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Dwight? Why are you such a jerk? I am trying to do something for my wife and you keep derailing-

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I'm barren, Jim.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: My trouser hives are void of honey. I had congress with Angela and the child that she bore did not issue from my loins. I thought I would be a father and instead I am a eunuch. Neutered by my own building.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Is this about the popcorn? Or the X on the ceiling? Dwight, that was a prank.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You mean you flooded my building with dangerous electromagnetic radiation as a prank?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: That's genius. That's the best prank you've ever done. [laughs]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I'll take it.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Andy?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Who is it?

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Um, is this a good time?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yeah. Perfect time. I'm right in the middle of a rooftop crisis. [takes paper from Nelly] Fine, let me read it. What do we have here? Uh, ok, [reading] blah blah blah blah blah, dah dah dah dah dah dah, you've made this very easy for me. It's unsignable.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Oh, why, is there something?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: It's inaccurate, dishonest and...in a word? Dongwater.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Ah well, perhaps I could rewrite some of the-

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Here's the thing, you asked me to do you a favor? I did it. I read it. Thank you very much to me for my time. Good luck with your impossible dream.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Alright then.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Dwight, sometimes it takes couples years to get pregnant.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Really? How long did it take you and Pam to conceive?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: That doesn't matter.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What position did you use to conceive?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Ok...that's not...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Regular? Or lady on her back? You used lady on her back, didn't you, you freak. Yuck, gross. Never mind, Jim.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [To Pete. Crying sounds come from behind Nelly's curtain] British women. Famously overemotional. Am I right?

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: I don't think that's Nelly.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Oh, oh no, no. Look, it's alright. [Erin cries, Nelly comforts her] It really isn't your fault. No, no. Look, it's...you were so kind. And it isn't anything to do with you.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Did you ever think that because you own the building, everyone in it, we're all kinda like your children?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You know there's a phrase about that in German. Bildenkinder. Used almost exclusively by childless landlords to console themselves. But now? I really understand it.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Well, now you have a bus full of real..bilden..kin..

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Bildenkinder.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: OK. And they're all dangerously close to not getting pie. And there's only one guy who can save them. It's not me.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh! [Jim reenters bus through hatch] Hey! How'd it go?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: It's pretty good actually.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: We bonded. We got to- [Dwight starts dropping into the bus on top of Jim]

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Whoa! Whoa! Dwight! [group reacts]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: When you don't get out of the way! Out of the way!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You feel OK now?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh, better than OK. [grabs Pam's shoulders] You know what honey? I'm gonna get you that rhubarb pie.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Well, actually, rhubarb is-

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Don't..

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: the one pie that I don't.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Don't..

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Everybody! Hang on! [Dwight pulls out quickly]

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Oh! [bus tears around corners as group crashes into each other]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [Group chants along] Pie! Pie! Pie!

Quote.Speaker: Group
Quote.Text: Pie! Pie! Pie! Pie! [cheers as they arrive]

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Oh.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I changed my mind. [gives Nelly papers]

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Oh, you signed it?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yeah. Not as is, obviously. Made a couple changes. Added some sentences at the end. Trust me it needed it. [laughs] Well, yeah, whatever. So. [walks away]

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: [Reading] "She's tough in business, but tender with the people she cares about. She'll make a wonderful mother to any child who can overlook weird accents."

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: I insult you, Oscar.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: I insult you! To your face!

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: I don't know what you're talking about.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Then why don't you do something about it?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: [laughs] Kevin, are you trying to get me to hit you? In the face with my pie?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: You don't have the guts. You stupid, dumb, doo doo face! [Oscar pies Kevin] Yes!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh my god. I'm getting so stuffed.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: We did it.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You did it.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: My name is Andy!

Quote.Speaker: Group
Quote.Text: [bored] Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I don't do drugs!

Quote.Speaker: Group
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Now check the style!

Quote.Speaker: Group
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Of Flatt & Scruggs!

Quote.Speaker: Group
Quote.Text: Yeah. [Andy plays banjo]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Role call.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Role call.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Role call.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: What?
